cells.data:
*Celestial Sphere*
poles align
equators align
ecliptic is the apparent path of the Sun around the celestial sphere
Polaris at north pole
*Zenith* is point directly above head
View stars in hemisphere
*Horizon* is where sky appears to touch the ground. You cannot see anything below your horizon
*Altitude* is angle between point on celestial sphere and horizon
*Meridian* 
Care about cardinal directions relative to horizon
*rising and setting*
Latitude (parallel to equator)
Longitude (perpendicular to equator)
Celestial sphere has same lines (celestial latitude, *i.e.* declinations; celestial longitude, *i.e.* right acensions)
